column4: When upgrading Ubuntu 11.04 to 11.10, I don't need to worry about losing any data or setup, will I?  Software RAID array, Evolution Mail, and my backup configuration are high on the list of concerns.
well you might lose evolution as part of the upgrade
since Gnome 2 isn't part of Ubuntu 11.10
that was what i was worried about.  So it will uninstall evolution and I will lose all that?
and your user stuff for evolution will probably be ok
i've been thinking of just switching to thunderbird for some time.
personaly if I was going ot use a email client I would use Thunderbird or maybe even  the email  client in Seamonkey,  but well never used Evolution as an actsaul email client before so hmm
anyway web mail for me for now :)
of course there's Kmail as well for example, if you don't mind having KDE apps
yeah i used to use web mail and regret setting up evolution.  I had the
i had the 'delete mail from server' option checked and it removed everything from the server so i just keep my own backup now.
i'd rather not use kde, gnome works great, wish Ubuntu would have stuck with Gnome 3
right, but you can use KDE  apps with Gnome, that's what I mean
i'm kind of a linux newb so i'm trying to keep it simple for awhile
yeah i'm aware of that.  Gnome 3 looks great.  I'm curious to see how Unity works in 11.10 but am hesitant to upgrade right away.

it seems according to bazhang that upgrading  from 11.04 to 11.10, that your evolution  emails and such will still be ok. and I did say you probably have the settings for that in home or wheever it saves earlier anyway
